prompt_template: Complete the timing conditions for reinvestment relief: EIS deferral relief is available when qualifying EIS shares are acquired within {gap1} year before and {gap2} years after the disposal of a chargeable asset. SEIS reinvestment relief requires reinvestment during {gap3}.
gap3_options: ["the same tax year", "the following tax year", "any time within 3 years"]
explanation: Per your notes: EIS reinvestment (deferral) window is 1 year before to 3 years after disposal; SEIS reinvestment relief requires reinvestment in qualifying SEIS shares during the same tax year.

explanation: Per your notes for small entities: a deemed salary is calculated; employment allowance cannot be used; dividends form part of the deemed salary and are not taxed separately as dividends; deemed salary is treated as paid on the last day of the tax year.

The deemed direct payment is taxed like employment income, and to avoid double tax the {gap4} is deducted before computing further IT/NIC when the PSC later pays salary/dividends.
explanation: Per your notes: for medium/large entities the client determines IR35 and issues an SDS; there is a 45-day challenge/response window; the DDP is taxed like employment and is deducted to prevent double taxation when PSC later remunerates the individual.

subtopic: Employee share schemes (SAYE / CSOP / EMI / SIP)
prompt_template: SIP withdrawal charges: If shares are held in the SIP for more than {gap1} years, there is no IT or NIC on withdrawal. If held for less than {gap2} years, IT and NIC are based on {gap3} at withdrawal. If held between {gap4} and {gap5} years, the IT/NIC charge is based on the lower of MV at award vs MV at withdrawal.
explanation: Per your notes: SIP >5 years: no IT/NIC on taking shares out. <3 years: IT/NIC based on market value at withdrawal. 3–5 years: IT/NIC based on the lower of MV at award and MV at withdrawal.
